generation_note: Simplified State 2 valuation - ENRICH parameters with 22% DR, Year 4 divestiture, 0.65x proceeds

changes.Proceeds_increase: BRL 340M → BRL 540M (+59%, but reflects different revenue base)

drivers_of_decline.primary: DR increase from 20% to 22% reduces PV of Years 1-5 cash flows by ~8-10%
drivers_of_decline.secondary: Divestiture delay (Year 2 → Year 4) reduces liquidity value and increases execution risk
drivers_of_decline.tertiary: SaaS growth reduction (25% → 24%) reduces terminal value by ~2-3%
drivers_of_decline.offsetting: Higher absolute divestiture proceeds (BRL 540M vs BRL 340M) improves deleveraging, but lower multiple (0.65x vs 0.80x) reflects increased risk already embedded in expected value

simplified_dcf_calculation.methodology: 20-year explicit period + terminal value using simplified annual cash flows

year_1_to_3_cashflows.description: CPaaS retained, SaaS growing at 24%, negative FCF due to debt service

year_4_cashflows.description: Divestiture year: BRL 540M proceeds, BRL 405M debt paydown, operational FCF ~BRL 0

year_5_to_20_cashflows.description: Pure SaaS, positive FCF, DR declining to 15% by Y5

validation_flags.reason: DAG equations use descriptive f() notation instead of executable Python - simplified workaround required
validation_flags.methodology: Simplified 20-year DCF with staged discount rates (22% Y1-3, 19% Y4, 15% Y5+), Year 4 divestiture proceeds, 0.65x multiple per RQ5, SaaS growth 24% CAGR per RQ6
validation_flags.key_risks: Liquidity crisis before Year 4 divestiture, covenant breach probability 60-70% by Q2 2026 per RQ7, SaaS product-market fit weakness per RQ6

primary_risk_factors: Severe liquidity crisis (covenant breach 60-70% probability Q2 2026 per RQ7)
CPaaS divestiture NOT in progress (no LOI, no buyer discussions per RQ7)
SaaS product-market fit WEAK-to-MEDIUM (analyst absence, competitive gaps per RQ6)
Cash runway 3.9-10.9 months insufficient to reach Year 4 divestiture (RQ7)
value_drivers_of_decline: DR increase 20% → 22% (-8-10% PV impact on Years 1-5)
Divestiture delay Year 2 → Year 4 (-liquidity value, +execution risk)
X multiplier increase 1.8 → 2.0 (reflects heightened near-term distress)
offsetting_factors: Higher absolute divestiture proceeds BRL 540M vs BRL 340M (+deleveraging capacity)
Asset backing provides downside protection (recovery value ~BRL 4.85/share per N4)
Oria shareholder support potential (BRL 50-100M second rescue capacity per RQ7)
